item.title: Charlie add a quote by Sir Edmund Hillary
item.description: "It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves." -- Sir Edmund Hillary

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Mabel Louise Robinson
item.description: "From the dog's point of view, his master is an elongated and abnormally cunning dog." -- Mabel Louise Robinson

item.title: Charlie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "When you don't cover up the world with words and labels, a sense of the miraculous returns to your life that was lost a long time ago when humanity, instead of using thought, became possessed by thought." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Rush
item.description:
"They say there are strangers who threaten us In our immigrants and infidels They say there is strangeness too dangerous In our theaters and bookstore shelves That those who know what's best for us Must rise and save us from ourselves
Quick to judge Quick to anger Slow to understand Ignorance and prejudice And fear walk hand in hand..." -- Rush

item.title: Charlie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Charlie add a quote by P.J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Never wear anything that panics the cat." -- P.J. O'Rourke

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Without water we are nothing", the traveler thought. "Even an emperor, denied water, would swiftly turn to dust. Water is the real monarch and we are all its slaves." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Wherever goodness lay, it did not lie in ritual, unthinking obeisance before a deity but rather, perhaps, in the slow clumsy, error-strewn working out of an individual or collective path." -- Salman Rushdie
